block.p: Miriam Dana Marcus, a daughter Harriet and Irving Marcus of Gloucester, Mass., was married yesterday in Bridgehampton, N.Y., to A. Jason Karas, the son of Nonnie Karas of Short Hills, N.J., and the late Jonathan Karas. Barbara Wilson, a town justice of East Hampton, N.Y., officiated, with Judge Faith S. Hochberg of the Federal District Court in Newark, at the Bridgehampton Tennis and Surf Club.

Mrs. Karas, 30, is a marketing and business development specialist in the Boston office of idealab!, which finances and supports fledgling Internet companies. She graduated from Williams College and received an M.B.A. in May from Columbia University. Her father is a senior partner in Lasser, Hochman, Marcus, Guryan & Kuskin, lawyers in Roseland, N.J. Her mother teaches English and heads the English department at the Oak Knoll School in Summit, N.J.

His father founded Science House, which offered science and technology consulting in Manchester-by-the-Sea, Mass.
